summary: Clemard Joseph Charles was a Haitian banker and businessman who was a confidant of President Duvalier. He is of interest to the CIA and State Department. Documents detail his plots against President Duvalier, his financial situation, and various assessments of his character and influence. Intelligence reports, cables, and telegrams detail his situation as a former bank president and political prisoner in Haiti from 1969 to 1974, covering his alleged involvement in anti-government plotting, his imprisonment, health issues, and attempts to secure his release or medical treatment. The documents also include interactions with Charles, assessments of his character and business dealings, and inquiries into his potential as a political figure. There is also mention of coordination between CIA, Army, and State Department regarding his potential as an asset.
significance: The documents suggest that Clemard Joseph Charles was a person of interest to the CIA and State Department due to his position in Haitian politics and his relationship with President Duvalier. However, the documents do not indicate any direct involvement in the JFK assassination.
